text: Herbert Reginald Dauphin Gybbon-Monypenny CBE (1895–1988) was a British diplomat. ==Biography== Born on 2 October 1895, Herbert Gybbon-Monypenny was educated at Bedford School. He entered the British Diplomatic Service and was Consul-General in Tunis, between 1943 and 1944, Oriental Counsellor at the British Embassy in Tehran, between 1944 and 1946, Consul-General in Frankfurt, between 1946 and 1951, Consul-General in Jerusalem, between 1951 and 1953, and British Ambassador to the Dominican Republic, between 1953 and 1955.Obituary, The Times, 26 February 1988, p.18 Herbert Gybbon-Monypenny was invested as a Commander of the Order of the British Empire in 1953. He retired from Her Majesty's Diplomatic Service in 1955 and died on 22 February 1988, aged 92. ==References== Category:1895 births Category:1988 deaths Category:People educated at Bedford School Category:Ambassadors of the United Kingdom to the Dominican Republic Category:Members of HM Diplomatic Service
title: Herbert Gybbon-Monypenny
